messages.title: A MESSAGE FROM IAN WALKER
messages.content: Ian Walker stood for the Conservatives in Sheffield Hallam at the last election. It was an honour to stand as the Conservative candidate in Sheffield Hallam, where at the last election, we nearly doubled the Conservative vote. Since then, last year, I have continued to serve the people in the Sheffield Hallam. I’m concentrating on getting better transport links and more business investment and growth in Sheffield. I am determined to see greater investment in our police force. I am determined to protect the beautiful environment that we have in Hallam by levelling up our economy, tackling the scourge of fly-tipping and building more homes. Being born and bred in Sheffield Hallam, I know the challenges that face us. Inspired by talking to you, I am passionate about our future, making sure we are supporting our young people on an orderly Brexit.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Conservative government has committed the biggest cash boost in hist. This amounts to an extra £33.9 billion per. Over £4 million has already been delivered to local clinics. Long term plan to make sure everyone in the UK can depend on the NHS to receive.

The Conservatives have announced that the UK is going to be the first major economy to commit to zero net carbon emissions by 2050. We have pledged £250m investment in small nuclear and nuclear R&D, including at local Sheffield businesses. £70m for Northern Powerhouse. The Government's investment in the green economy.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: PUTTING SHEFFIELD ON THE TRANSPORT MAP
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Have had discussions with Transport for the North. Sheffield’s economy will thrive. Improved transport links to deprived areas. Machinf regions in the UK is at the heart of new Conservative who will start gove in the north.

Most people in Sheffield, like the country as a whole, voted to leave the European Union. The Conservative government is respecting that democratic choice and is determined that we get Brexit done responsibly and sensibly. Sheffield voted overwhelmingly to leave and I represent that mandate. We need an MP who will support the government in getting Brexit over the line!
